metadata.title: CVE-2011-1677 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
mount in util-linux 2.19 and earlier does not remove the /etc/mtab~ lockfile after a failed attempt to add a mount entry, which has unspecifiedimpact and local attack vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 1:2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
libblkid1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
libmount1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
libuuid1 - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
mount - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
util-linux - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
util-linux-locales - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
uuid-runtime - 2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4').
util-linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-5.1ubuntu20.4').
